channel.title: 2020 Artist Showcase (intro / re-intro)
channel.description:
Hear ye! Hear ye! We are nearly slipping into 2020, so what better time than right now to take a minute and reflect on the past year and think about the upcoming year. There's been an influx of some new names and of course some folks who've been around the block a few times. Take a minute to introduce yourself (or re-introduce yourself!) to the community and share any info you're comfortable sharing with us. Showcase some work, tell us a little about what your goals are - totally up to you.
You can highlight everything from the picture down and hit quote to get the template, or just copy and paste. Whatever floats your boat! Glasses raised to a fantastic and productive 2020!!
> ![download|259x194](https://global.discourse-cdn.com/standard10/uploads/auxy/original/2X/b/bfad3be4b22558489f7b0935c34a8f7ce4bd6a79.png) > **Name (or producer name):** > **Other / Historical Names:** None. > **Country of residence:** xxxxxxxxx > **Age (optional):** > **Gender (optional):** > **Preferred Genre(s) for creating tracks:** > **Preferred Genre(s) for listening to:** > **My best tracks (3 max):** > **Most commonly used Auxy sounds or sound packs?** > **Did I achieve my musical goals for 2019?** > **Musical goals for 2020:** > **Fav music related websites:** > **One thing you would like to see in a 2020 sound pack?**
> **Online presence:** > > * **Soundcloud:** > * **Instagram:** > * **Twitter:** > * **Discord:** > * **Youtube:** > * **Snapchat:** > * **Spotify:** > * **Website(s):** > * **Facebook:** > * **[Other]:**

item.title: 2020 Artist Showcase (intro / re-intro)
item.dc:creator: Slash
item.description:
Sorry for the revive buuuut…


(Real Name): Benjamin Allen Mayo
(Producer Name): STEREOFYLDZ
Other / Historical Names: $L@$H, from late 2018 to October of this year, (Before that it was DJ $L@$H).
Country of residence: United States
Age (optional): 16 (Born July 8, 2004)
Gender (optional): Male
Preferred Genre(s) for creating tracks: Progressive House, as well as Big Room
Preferred Genre(s) for listening to: Dubstep, Future Bass, Any house subgenre, Trance, DnB, and Country
Favorite Artists: Deadmau5, Porter Robinson, Martin Garrix, @stereofield , Linkin Park, Queen, Green Day, Madeon, Skrillex, The Prodigy, @Eswyn, Zedd, and Knife Party
My best tracks (3 max): Changing Lanes, Paradise, and Ice Cream Cone
Most commonly used Auxy sounds or sound packs? Spray, The Battery and Dawn Drum Kits, Drill, Dirt, Climb, and Pasta.
Did I achieve my musical goals for 2018? No, because I’m not the goal setting type
Musical goals for 2020: Already achieved, as I did a collab with someone (even if it was my sister)
Fav music related websites: Auxy Disco, r/edm, and SoundCloud
One thing you would like to see in a 2020 sound pack? I would like to see some hard dance packs, as well as big room and trance packs.

Online presence:

  • Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/stereofyldz
  • Instagram: None
  • Twitter: Yeah, I’d rather not constantly see people on that app argue about politics (Twitter has been nothing but a cesspool of arguing about politics for the past 4 years, so I try to avoid it at all costs.)
  • Youtube: Antonio The Sheep (Idk why, that’s a character i make videos out of, though I do GarageBand videos on there too)
  • Spotify: I wish. Because I use cash (I don’t have a credit card of my own), I wouldn’t be able to make any money off my tracks anyway.
  • Reddit: u/stereofyldz

Read full topic

item.title: 2020 Artist Showcase (intro / re-intro)
item.dc:creator: ben
item.description:
Name (or producer name): Benjamin Humpal (Sei)
Other / Historical Names: surf, vectr, about 20 other irrelevant names I made for fun
Country of residence: ’Merica. Enough said.
Age (optional): 16
Gender (optional): Male.
Preferred Genre(s) for creating tracks: Indie Pop, Hip-Hop, Lo-fi
Preferred Genre(s) for listening to: Anything except metal and classical.
My best tracks (3 max): Midnight Conversations (feat. Chloe), Leaving Me Behind (feat. Schwarzie), Come Over Later (feat. Petal Boy)
Most commonly used Auxy sounds or sound packs? I haven’t completed a track in Auxy in a very long time, honestly, but I try to use a broad range of sounds. My favorite would have to be Sweet Sine because of the versatility it has.
Did I achieve my musical goals for 2019? Definitely.
Musical goals for 2020: I honestly don’t know. Maybe focus less on promotion and more on just consistently putting out music I’d want to hear. Maybe release an album or at least an EP. I don’t know yet.
Fav music related websites: SoundCloud, Spotify, SPForums (great for digging for samples to work with), Reddit (not solely music-related, but there are plenty of good areas to look for music inspiration), the Russian website that I (totally legally) downloaded 3 unreleased songs from my favorite rap album of 2019 that never made the final cut
One thing you would like to see in a 2020 sound pack? I feel like people focus too much on new, new, more new. I’d prefer more diversity in the music being created in this app, rather than focusing on new features or new sounds. Lenberg, Fredrik, and the other devs can only do so much. Sometimes I feel like Auxy producers depend on the devs to “catch up” to what their requests are, when they should really be “catching up” to the expectations the development team had for the quality of music coming from Auxy. Yeah, new sounds are cool, but they’re not gonna make your music any better unless you put the work in yourself.
Sorry for going off for a bit there, but I feel like it needs to be said somewhere, and this is lowkey enough of a thread to where it won’t cause a huge uproar (I’m getting flashbacks to the unsuccessful vectr rant in early 2018).

Online presence:

  • Soundcloud: http://www.soundcloud.com/seikatsuuu
  • Instagram: I change my name a lot but just look up Ben Humpal and it should show up.
  • Twitter: Not yet. Never got into Twitter, although seeing screenshots of some of the tweets people put out there definitely makes it tempting.
  • Discord: sei#7583
  • Youtube: Not yet. Stay tuned though…
  • Snapchat: I actually do have a snap, but I’d prefer to keep my music and personal life separate for now. Maybe in the future though.
  • Spotify: I have one, but it’s barely active. Midnight Conversations is still doing numbers on there somehow, but other than that, there’s nothing noteworthy. If you insist on checking it out, look up Midnight Conversations by Sei on there and it should save you from scrolling through all of the artist profiles named Sei (there’s surprisingly a lot).
  • Website(s): I don’t have one but check out keemworld.com if you want to know who my favorite rapper is.
  • Facebook: I am NOT a boomer.
  • [Other]: I know I have not been active in this community, and I’d like to change that. Even though I am not an active Auxy user, and this forum is intended for— well, active Auxy users, I figured I’d check in every now and then, see what’s going on, and try to provide insight to people that caters to a broader audience (not just specifically Auxy-based advice, but advice from a multitude of music areas of interest that would help users hopefully bridge the gap between Auxy and the main DAWs of choice.)

Read full topic

https://soundcloud.com/user-341022278/windy-trap-type-beat/s-Jg6zNEacgTU

Most commonly used Auxy sounds or sound packs? Retrofit - Boom Bass - Sweet Pads - Save The Oceans - Dark Patterns - DX100 From Mars - Martland Guitars - Mixed Moods - Heavy Bass - Orchestral Strings - Sublab
Did i achieve my music goals for 2019? Yes.
I made an album.
I featured my friends in a song.
I reached 2000 views on YT.
Officially a trap producer.
Musical goals for 2020: Be the popular auxy trap producer I always wanted to be.
Favorite music related websites: SoundCloud & YouTube.
One thing you would like to see in a 2020 sound pack? Trap effects, church bells, harder trap 808s, overused trap snares, claps & chants & retro sounds.

Online presence:

SoundCloud: theCRØSSYjosh
YouTube: XFadełemønadeBOII
Discord: theCROSSYjosh #6037

Hey guys. Thanks for reading my re-introduction! Hope you really enjoyed it. Now gotta go. I have it hit the trap block. As always guys, Peace & May Allah Bless you all!!!
